title: Dpex
author: Dpex
content: üöÄ Welcome to Dpex-exchange! üöÄWe are pleased to welcome you to our cryptocurrency exchanger, where your convenience and safety are our priority. Dpex-exchange is a place where you can easily and securely exchange your cryptocurrencies, participate in trades and manage your assets.üí° Why choose Dpex-exchange?Fast and reliable exchange transactions.Wide range of supported cryptocurrencies.Convenient and intuitive interface.Protect your funds with advanced security technologies.Professional support and responsive team.üîí Your safety is our priority!We make every effort to ensure the security of your funds and data. Our team strictly enforces security and privacy standards.üìà Trade and investmentOn Dpex-exchange you can actively participate in trading and also use tools for investing in cryptocurrencies. We offer many opportunities for growth and development in the crypto world.ü§ù Join us!We value each of our clients and are ready to help you realize your cryptocurrency goals. Join Dpex-exchange and discover the world of cryptocurrencies with us!Follow our updates, news and events. If you have questions or need help, don't hesitate to contact our support.Sincerely,Dpex-exchange commandüåê Our website: https://dpex-exchange.com/üìß Contact us: info@dpex-exchange.comüì± We are on social networks: https://t.me/DpexinfTelegram (https://t.me/Dpexinf)D Pex

comments.author: WillyAp
comments.body: Neat, a russian site with a join us in an english forum. At least bitcoin to bitcoin? Quiet senseless to go that way. At least warn us.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: I don't know Russian but I found something rather interesting.Where does your exchange appear in this blacklist? The introducing translation goes;Quote‚ö° Blacklist of pyramid schemes and scams [and reviews]...The blacklist includes organizations that have signs of a financial pyramid according to the classification of the Central Bank; bank; organizations exhibiting characteristics of a matrix pyramid (mass recruitment of friends, "tables"); collecting money from pensioners and other vulnerable segments of the population; hype; organizations with negative reviews; structures providing financial services without a license and other scams, excluding pseudo-brokers, cooperatives (we also do not recommend dealing with them), and some other categories. The list was updated on October 29, 2023....Dpex ‚Äî cryptocurrency exchange, +380947100330; RGV Financial Ltd; Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, Kingstown; Suite 305, Griffith Corporate Centre, Box 151023904 BC 2017 (findpex.com)Who is going to trust such a blacklisted site linked to pyramid schemes and scams?

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Potential scam aside, you should probably post this on the Announcement or discussion board, since it doesn't look like you're trying to get inputs or build a project at all. I do agree that you need to solve that blacklist first before encouraging users to visit your website if you're serious about it. With how competitive exchange landscape has become, it is hard to see how you'll stay afloat with your current proposal.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on October 30, 2023, 10:59:25 PMI don't know Russian but I found something rather interesting.Where does your exchange appear in this blacklist? Who is going to trust such a blacklisted site linked to pyramid schemes and scams?Nice catch OP cannot argue why they are on the list, the site boosts that QuoteWe have been warning since 2014And the site looks like a clone or a phishing site of dpex.io / https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/dpex they have the same name, and people might think it is a mirror site or even a sister site, It is not good when a new platform comes in with the same name and with a similar platform, they might have a bad intention of deceiving Dpex users.Let's see how OP will explain the similarity

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: robelneo on October 31, 2023, 12:08:31 PMAnd the site looks like a clone or a phishing site of dpex.io / https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/dpex they have the same name, and people might think it is a mirror site or even a sister site, It is not good when a new platform comes in with the same name and with a similar platform, they might have a bad intention of deceiving Dpex users.Let's see how OP will explain the similarity Previously, they were on the domain findpex.com, which has expired https://web.archive.org/web/20230401191245/http://findpex.com/It seems that because of the exposed scams in the past, they decided to start a new life in a new domain.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Without adding an English translation, it is better to move this topic to the local board.Any service that treats Bitcoin as clean and dirty should be avoided, there should be no comparison between currencies, which should have the same value.I do not see a fundamental difference between the service you provide and any other service.You have almost the same exchange rates, and since the service is new, it is difficult to trust you. You must also deny any association with findpex.com, which has received several scam reports.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on October 31, 2023, 01:15:18 PMWithout adding an English translation, it is better to move this topic to the local board.There is an English translation of the site, in the top left corner, but that does not make it more acceptable for the market outside of Russia. Of course, only if we ignore the dubious legality of the business.Although regardless of translation, in the exchange option of FIAT pairs, there are only exchanges in Rubles.

comments.author: moneystery
comments.body: why is it taking so long to finish loading your website? and i also saw that it was available in russian the first time i visited which was quite confusing for me. the services and features you offer are the same as exchanges in general, nothing special.and since there are reports that your website is a pyramid scheme and you can't explain it, i think it's too early to trust your service and apparently i can't use this exchange.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: examplens on November 01, 2023, 12:09:32 AMThere is an English translation of the site, in the top left corner, but that does not make it more acceptable for the market outside of Russia. Of course, only if we ignore the dubious legality of the business.Although regardless of translation, in the exchange option of FIAT pairs, there are only exchanges in Rubles. ¬†I don't remember that it was there, and perhaps I didn't notice it, but I decided to visit the site now and see what I found:Quote–îopo–≥–∏e –øo–ª—å–∑o–≤a—Çe–ª–∏, –≤ –¥a–Ω–Ω—ã–π –ºo–ºe–Ω—Ç –øpo–∏cxo–¥–∏—Ç o–±–Ωo–≤–ªe–Ω–∏e ca–π—Ça. –üo–∂a–ªy–πc—Ça, –øp–∏xo–¥–∏—Çe –øo–∑–∂e.According to Google translation, it appears that they are updating the site, so let us see what the site will look like after the update.Quote from: moneystery on November 01, 2023, 03:41:15 PMwhy is it taking so long to finish loading your website? and i also saw that it was available in russian the first time i visited which was quite confusing for me. the services and features you offer are the same as exchanges in general, nothing special.It was an unsuccessful start. I hope the update will be better than the incomplete start.

comments.author: virasog
comments.body: Quote from: WillyAp on October 30, 2023, 08:39:51 PMNeat, a russian site with a join us in an english forum. At least bitcoin to bitcoin? Quiet senseless to go that way. At least warn us. This seems to be an instant exchange where you can convert from Bitcoin to Tether or Bitcoin to Fiat (RUB) or vice versa. But it only supports the Russian currency Ruble.I would usually not trust any random instant or P2P exchange unless there are some good positive reviews and the site is trusted one.Just going randomly to the site, I didn't find the exchange rate to be of any value. Where for 1 bitcoin you will get less than 32000$ while the current bitcoin price is well over 34000$. Even if anyone wanted to use the site, the exchange rate isn't a realistic one.

comments.author: wallet4bitcoin
comments.body: More work needs to be done here. I do no want to say that I dont trust the exchange but if you feel like you have something to achieve, whether it be genuine or not, you should focus on leaving it neat enough without traces or suspicions. Imagine if I have to see a Russian write up for whats supposed to be an English audience, it is obviously not what you wished for that will play out. Thanks all the same for taking out time to work on the exchange

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: wallet4bitcoin on December 17, 2023, 10:33:11 AMMore work needs to be done here. I do no want to say that I dont trust the exchange but if you feel like you have something to achieve, whether it be genuine or not, you should focus on leaving it neat enough without traces or suspicions. Imagine if I have to see a Russian write up for whats supposed to be an English audience, it is obviously not what you wished for that will play out. Thanks all the same for taking out time to work on the exchangeIt's not worth the effort and praise, mate. The site is probably a scam if you take your time to read up the replies and findings above. I will be surprised if the OP himself comes back to this ANN to defend his scam because he has been exposed.

comments.author: steve5946
comments.body: There seems to be another exchange answering Dpex, which complicates things a little bit. Is your company the same with Dpex.io?

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: steve5946 on December 19, 2023, 09:37:39 PMThere seems to be another exchange answering Dpex, which complicates things a little bit. Is your company the same with Dpex.io?Just read the replies about you might get a clue, but if you are expecting an answer from OP then it's unfortunate you might not get any as he may not log in here again. That's what scammers do most of the time.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on December 17, 2023, 09:11:02 PMQuote from: wallet4bitcoin on December 17, 2023, 10:33:11 AMMore work needs to be done here. I do no want to say that I dont trust the exchange but if you feel like you have something to achieve, whether it be genuine or not, you should focus on leaving it neat enough without traces or suspicions. Imagine if I have to see a Russian write up for whats supposed to be an English audience, it is obviously not what you wished for that will play out. Thanks all the same for taking out time to work on the exchangeIt's not worth the effort and praise, mate. The site is probably a scam if you take your time to read up the replies and findings above. I will be surprised if the OP himself comes back to this ANN to defend his scam because he has been exposed.If it's truly scam, then they couldn't scam anyone since their site currently isn't working where CloudFlare says "Connection timed out Error code 522". I guess nobody fell for their trick, so they don't bother check or maintain their website.
